title: Marseille: Charges filed against three tactical unit police officers in fatal shooting case
description: The officers face allegations of armed violence unintentionally causing the death of Mohamed Bendriss, 27, during the night of looting from July 1 to early in the morning on July 2.

title: Neill Blomkamp's 'Gran Turismo': The failed marriage of video games and cinema
description: In his adaptation, the South African and Canadian film director fails in his attempt to merge gaming, racing and cinema, in large part due to an unconvincing and unoriginal script.

title: Women's World Cup: Despite rising prize money, female players still paid four times less than men
description: FIFA has significantly increased the bonuses paid to female players for taking part in the World Cup in 2023, which they say will have an 'impact' on the lives and careers of the female players.

title: Iran: American inmates transferred from prison to house arrest as part of prisoner swap deal
description: Iran has transferred five Iranian-Americans from prison to house arrest in exchange for billions of dollars frozen in South Korea, US and Iranian officials said Thursday.

title: Migrant deaths in the Mediterranean have already exceeded 2022's death toll
description: In graphs: The number of people reported dead or missing in the Mediterranean Sea since the start of 2023 is already higher than figures for each of the previous four years.

title: Niger: ECOWAS orders immediate activation of its 'standby force' but says it still favors peaceful resolution
description: Nigerian President Bola Tinubu stressed that no option had been ruled out to ensure a rapid return to constitutional order in Niger, including the use of force as a last resort.

title: Kuwait and Lebanon move to ban 'Barbie' ahead of film's Middle Eastern release
description: The movie seems to have drawn fire because of its flamboyance and broad message of inclusion and gender equality in a region where homosexuality is widely seen as taboo.

title: Three French police officers charged over man's death during riots
description: The 27 year old died in Marseille earlier this summer. An autopsy showed marks on his chest consistent with the impact of a shot from a blast ball commonly used by police.

title: Tobacco waste is an 'ecotoxic bomb' for the planet
description: In addition to plastic particles, cigarette butts release thousands of toxic chemical substances (nicotine, heavy metals, ammonia). Electronic cigarettes pose an even greater risk to the environment.

title: 'Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem' successfully reinvents the heroic reptiles
description: This new adaptation of the adventures of the four cartoon mutants modernizes the story and plunges the characters into an inspired graphic universe.

title: Central African Republic: President Touadéra, a reserved teacher turned fearsome politician
description: The 'yes' vote has just won the referendum paving the way for Faustin-Archange Touadéra to continue his presidency with no term limits. No one expected such a move from this discreet university lecturer, who has made his country the Wagner Group's gateway to Africa.

title: Armed jihadist groups are on the move following the coup in Niger
description: As the leaders of ECOWAS countries were due to meet in Nigeria on Thursday to discuss their stance toward the new self-proclaimed power in Niamey, the junta’s security policy was still unknown.

title: 'Singin' in the Rain' by Arthur Freed and Nacio Herb Brown: Musical happiness under an umbrella
description: 'The Art of Rain' (Part 5): The song was first performed by Cliff Edwards in Charles Reisner's musical 'The Hollywood Revue of 1929' but was most famously interpreted by Gene Kelly.

title: After deaths of 11 people in holiday center fire, eastern France town looks for answers
description: The origin of the fire in the Alsatian village is still unknown. Investigators will have to determine whether safety rules were respected.

title: France and Mali suspend issuing visas as diplomatic row escalates
description: While France-Mali relations have been rocky since the coup in Bamako in 2020, tensions across the region have risen sharply since the coup in neighboring Niger on July 26.

title: Lula scores diplomatic win at the Amazon summit in Belem, despite limited progress
description: 'Urgent action is needed to avoid the point of no return,' the final declaration states. However, there are no concrete targets regarding deforestation, and the Brazilian president himself insisted that oil not be included in the text.

title: Niger: Six questions to understand the situation after the coup
description: Since the coup overthrowing President Mohamed Bazoum, West African countries have been divided between military regimes supporting the coup and those calling for the restoration of Niger's constitutional order.

title: French holiday center which caught ablaze was in breach of fire safety standards
description: Local authorities cite a lack of safety inspections, incorrect smoke detectors, and overcrowding of the holiday home which caught fire, killing 11 people.

title: Poland plans to deploy 10,000 troops to its border with Belarus
description: Poland has contended with migrants arriving at the border from Belarus trying to enter the country illegally and now faces a new worry after Wagner group fighters deployed to Belarus following a short-lived mutiny in Russia in June.

title: Painter Rakajoo tackles comics and canvases
description: 'Before the exhibition' (1/6). All summer long, the self-taught artist is preparing his first exhibition opening in October at the Palais de Tokyo in Paris.

title: Life after a femicide: 'Until then, we were the grandparents. We changed roles'
description: Relatives of women killed by their partner or former partner, many of whom find themselves responsible for these women's children, spoke to Le Monde about the obstacle course that accompanied the pain of losing their loved ones.

title: Scientific study rewrites Venus's evolution and Earth's future
description: A groundbreaking study by a Franco-Swiss team of researchers calls into question conventional theories about the evolution of rocky planets' atmospheres.

title: Turkey's opposition takes up the environmental struggle
description: Near the town of Milas in southwest Turkey, villagers and environmentalists are mobilizing against the expansion of a controversial coal mine after Turkey's President Erdogan dismissed the protests and called the campaign leaders 'marginals.'

title: Ecuador: Presidential candidate Fernando Villavicencio shot and killed at campaign event
description: The 59-year-old centrist was one of eight candidates in the first round of the presidential election scheduled for August 20.

title: Ukrainian Maryna Vroda's militant cinema at the Locarno Festival
description: In her first feature film, 'Stepne', the Ukrainian filmmaker navigates political upheaval, personal struggles, and the unfolding narrative of Ukrainian history.

title: Enigmatic singer-songwriter Sixto Rodriguez has died
description: Brought out of relative obscurity in 2012 by the documentary 'Searching for Sugar Man', the American singer-songwriter passed away at 81 years old.

title: China, in contrast with the rest of the world, is facing deflation
description: The fall in prices illustrates low household spending and the country's difficult economic recovery, eight months after the abandonment of the Zero Covid policy.
